column1: Chandler: Dehydrated Japanese noodles under fluorescent lights... does it get better than this?
column4: Dehydrated Japanese noodles under fluorescent lights... does it get better than this?

column1: Shelley: Question. You're not dating anybody, are you, because I met somebody who would be perfect for you.
column4: Question. You're not dating anybody, are you, because I met somebody who would be perfect for you.

column1: Chandler: Ah, y'see, perfect might be a problem. Had you said 'co-dependent', or 'self-destructive'...
column4: Ah, y'see, perfect might be a problem. Had you said 'co-dependent', or 'self-destructive'...

column1: Shelley: Do you want a date Saturday?
column4: Do you want a date Saturday?

column1: Chandler: Yes please.
column4: Yes please.

column1: Shelley: Okay. He's cute, he's funny, he's-
column4: Okay. He's cute, he's funny, he's-

column1: Chandler: He's a he?
column4: He's a he?

column1: Shelley: Well yeah! ...Oh God. I- just- I thought- Good, Shelley. I'm just gonna go flush myself down the toilet now... Okay, goodbye...
column4: Well yeah! ...Oh God. I- just- I thought- Good, Shelley. I'm just gonna go flush myself down the toilet now... Okay, goodbye...

column1: Chandler: ...Couldn't enjoy a cup of noodles after that. I mean, is that ridiculous? Can you believe she actually thought that?
column4: ...Couldn't enjoy a cup of noodles after that. I mean, is that ridiculous? Can you believe she actually thought that?

column1: Rachel: Um... yeah. Well, I mean, when I first met you, y'know, I thought maybe, possibly, you might be...
column4: Um... yeah. Well, I mean, when I first met you, y'know, I thought maybe, possibly, you might be...

column1: Chandler: You did?
column4: You did?

column1: Rachel: Yeah, but then you spent Phoebe's entire birthday party talking to my breasts, so then I figured maybe not.
column4: Yeah, but then you spent Phoebe's entire birthday party talking to my breasts, so then I figured maybe not.

column1: Chandler: Huh. Did, uh... any of the rest of you guys think that when you first met me?
column4: Huh. Did, uh... any of the rest of you guys think that when you first met me?

column1: Monica: I did.
column4: I did.

column1: Phoebe: Yeah, I think so, yeah.
column4: Yeah, I think so, yeah.

column1: Joey: Not me.
column4: Not me.

column1: Ross: Nono, me neither. Although, uh, y'know, back in college, Susan Sallidor did.
column4: Nono, me neither. Although, uh, y'know, back in college, Susan Sallidor did.

column1: Chandler: You're kidding! Did you tell her I wasn't?
column4: You're kidding! Did you tell her I wasn't?

column1: Ross: No. No, it's just 'cause, uh, I kinda wanted to go out with her too, so I told her, actually, you were seeing Bernie Spellman... who also liked her, so...
column4: No. No, it's just 'cause, uh, I kinda wanted to go out with her too, so I told her, actually, you were seeing Bernie Spellman... who also liked her, so...

column1: Chandler: Well, this is fascinating. So, uh, what is it about me?
column4: Well, this is fascinating. So, uh, what is it about me?

column1: Phoebe: I dunno, 'cause you're smart, you're funny...
column4: I dunno, 'cause you're smart, you're funny...

column1: Chandler: Ross is smart and funny, d'you ever think that about him?
column4: Ross is smart and funny, d'you ever think that about him?

column1: All: Yeah! Right!
column4: Yeah! Right!

column1: Chandler: WHAT IS IT?!
column4: WHAT IS IT?!

column1: Monica: Okay, I-I d'know, you-you just- you have a quality.
column4: Okay, I-I d'know, you-you just- you have a quality.

column1: All: Yes. Absolutely. A quality.
column4: Yes. Absolutely. A quality.

column1: Chandler: Oh, oh, a quality, good, because I was worried you guys were gonna be vague about this.
column4: Oh, oh, a quality, good, because I was worried you guys were gonna be vague about this.

column1: Monica: Hello? Hello? Oh! Rachel, it's Paolo calling from Rome.
column4: Hello? Hello? Oh! Rachel, it's Paolo calling from Rome.

column1: Rachel: Oh my God! Calling from Rome! Bon giorno, caro mio.
column4: Oh my God! Calling from Rome!  Bon giorno, caro mio.

column4: So he's calling from Rome. I could do that. Just gotta go to Rome.

column1: Rachel: Monica, your dad just beeped in, but can you make it quick? Talking to Rome. I'm talking to Rome.
column4: Monica, your dad just beeped in, but can you make it quick? Talking to Rome.  I'm talking to Rome.

column1: Monica: Hey dad, what's up? Oh God. Ross, it's Nana.
column4: Hey dad, what's up?  Oh God. Ross, it's Nana.

column1: Ross: So, uh, how's she doing?
column4: So, uh, how's she doing?

column4: The doctor says it's a matter of hours.

column1: Monica: How-how are you, Mom?
column4: How-how are you, Mom?

column1: Mrs. Geller: Me? I'm fine, fine. I'm glad you're here. ...What's with your hair?
column4: Me? I'm fine, fine. I'm glad you're here. ...What's with your hair?

column4: What?

column4: What's different?

column1: Monica: Nothing.
column4: Nothing.

column4: Oh, maybe that's it.

column1: Monica: She is unbelievable, our mother is...
column4: She is unbelievable, our mother is...

column1: Ross: Okay, relax, relax. We are gonna be here for a while, it looks like, and we still have boyfriends and your career to cover.
column4: Okay, relax, relax. We are gonna be here for a while, it looks like, and we still have boyfriends and your career to cover.

column1: Monica: Oh God!
column4: Oh God!

column1: Monica: The fuzzy little mints at the bottom of her purse.
column4: The fuzzy little mints at the bottom of her purse.

column1: Ross: Oh! ...Yeah, they were gross. Oh, you know what I loved? Her Sweet 'n' Los. How she was always stealing them from- from restaurants.
column4: Oh! ...Yeah, they were gross. Oh, you know what I loved? Her Sweet 'n' Los. How she was always stealing them from- from restaurants.

column4: She looks so small.

column4: Well, at least she's with Pop-Pop and Aunt Phyllis now.

column4: What is going on?!

column4: Y'know how-how the nurse said that-that Nana had passed? Well, she's not, quite..

column4: What's going on?

column4: This almost never happens!

column4: I just have to know, okay. Is it my hair?

column4: Yes, Chandler, that's exactly what it is. It's your hair.

column4: I dunno, it's weird. I mean, I know she's gone, but I just don't feel, uh...

column4: Maybe that's 'cause she's not really gone.

column4: We checked. A lot.

column1: Phoebe: Hm, I mean maybe no-one ever really goes. Ever since my mom died, every now and then, I get the feeling that she's like right here, y'know? Oh! And Debbie, my best friend from junior high- got struck by lightning on a miniature golf course- I always get this really strong Debbie vibe whenever I use one of those little yellow pencils, y'know? ...I miss her.
column4: Hm, I mean maybe no-one ever really goes. Ever since my mom died, every now and then, I get the feeling that she's like right here, y'know?  Oh! And Debbie, my best friend from junior high- got struck by lightning on a miniature golf course- I always get this really strong Debbie vibe whenever I use one of those little yellow pencils, y'know? ...I miss her.

column4: Now, see, I don't believe any of that. I think once you're dead, you're dead! You're gone! You're worm food!  ...So Chandler looks gay, huh?

column4: ...And then we throw your body in the water... Gee, that does sound fun.
